item.title: 中国电力需求激增引发气候难题
item.description: 中国的电力需求正成为全球应对气候变化的关键焦点。【原文：China’s electricity demand is becoming a key focal point in the global fight against climate change.】

item.title: 洛杉矶火灾难民与雪鸟争抢棕榈泉租房
item.description: 米尔德里德-布里格诺尼（Mildred Brignoni）试图在洛杉矶的家中坚持下去，即使日落大火舔舐的距离很近，她可以从窗户看到火焰。【原文：Mildred Brignoni tried to stick it out in her Los Angeles home, even as the Sunset Fire licked close enough that she could see the flames from her window.】

item.title: 特朗普的气候鞭策
item.description: 今天的时事通讯回顾了唐纳德-特朗普总统本周马不停蹄地发布的一系列行政命令，以及这些行政命令对美国气候进步的意义。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享全文。如需了解更多气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks back at President Donald Trump's nonstop stream of executive orders this week and what they mean for US climate progress. You can read and share the full story on Bloomberg.com. For more climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 野火的名字是怎么来的？取决于当地救灾人员
item.description:
第一批到达现场的工作人员通常会根据野火的起火地点为野火命名。【原文：

The first crews on the ground usually name a wildfire, drawing on the place where it started.

】

item.title: 特朗普的第一周以大量气候倒退告终
item.description:
新总统发布了一系列命令，旨在促进化石燃料的发展，扭转应对全球变暖的政策。【原文：

The new president issued a barrage of orders seeking to boost fossil fuels and reverse policies that address global warming. 

】

item.title: 气候变化让埃欧文这样的猛烈冬季风暴变得更强
item.description:
更热的海洋和大气是提高冬季天气强度和降雨量的关键因素。【原文：

A hotter ocean and atmosphere are key ingredients to up the intensity and rainfall of winter weather.

】

item.title: 风暴清理工作开始，爱尔兰各地数千人停电
item.description: 风暴 "艾云 "席卷而来的强阵风破坏了建筑物，阻断了道路，爱尔兰全岛仍有数千人断电。【原文：Thousands are still without power across the island of Ireland after Storm Eowyn swept in strong gusts that damaged buildings and blocked roads.】

item.title: 新加坡为何努力避免 "涸泽而渔
item.description: 欢迎来到新加坡版。每周，我们将为您介绍亚洲最具活力的经济体之一。如果您还没有注册，请在这里注册。【原文：Welcome to Singapore Edition. Each week we bring you insights into one of Asia’s most dynamic economies. If you haven’t yet, please sign up here.】

item.title: 预报周末有雨，洛杉矶火区附近有山体滑坡风险
item.description: 随着南加州准备迎接入春以来的第一场大雨，洛杉矶正在为近期野火附近可能出现的山体滑坡和危险的径流做好准备。【原文：Los Angeles is bracing for potential landslides and dangerous runoff near recent wildfires, as Southern California prepares for its first significant rains since spring.】

item.title: 特朗普冻结能源部开支和贷款
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的一份能源部代理部长的备忘录，作为 "全面审查 "的一部分，特朗普政府已经停止了能源部的开支、贷款和其他行动，以确保它们与总统的优先事项保持一致。【原文：The Trump administration has halted spending, loans and other actions at the Energy Department as part of a “comprehensive review” to ensure they align with the president’s priorities, according to a memo from the agency’s acting secretary seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 新野火在圣地亚哥南部燃烧，预报显示将有降雨
item.description: 由于南加州即将迎来九个多月以来的首次明显降雨，消防员们正在争分夺秒地控制圣迭戈县一场迅速蔓延的灌木丛大火，而整个地区的其他大火仍在继续燃烧。【原文：Firefighters are racing to contain a fast-growing brush fire in San Diego County, while other blazes continue to burn throughout the region as Southern California inches closer to its first significant rainfall in more than nine months.】

item.title: 英国风电场在暴风雨中关闭导致电价上涨
item.description: 在 "艾奥文风暴 "期间，英国的狂风导致风力涡轮机关闭，推动电价在白天大幅上涨。【原文：Fierce wind gusts in the UK shuttered wind turbines in the middle of Storm Éowyn, pushing electricity prices to rise sharply during the day.】

item.title: 在洛杉矶最需要联邦紧急事务管理局的时候，特朗普却质疑它的未来
item.description:
该机构目前正忙于应对全国范围内的 100 多起重大灾难。【原文：

The agency is currently juggling the response to more than 100 major disasters nationwide.

】

item.title: 人工智能需求激增，NextEra 采取措施重启核电站
item.description: NextEra Energy Inc. 已要求美国监管机构对其已关闭的杜安阿诺德核电厂的许可证进行变更，这是在人工智能和数据中心用电量激增的情况下可能重启爱荷华州核电厂的第一步。【原文：NextEra Energy Inc. has asked US regulators for a licensing change for its shuttered Duane Arnold nuclear plant, a first step toward potentially restarting the Iowa facility amid soaring power consumption from artificial intelligence and data centers.】

item.title: 惠誉称：洛杉矶大火对再保险公司 "影响不大
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）称，全球最大的再保险公司有望避免因洛杉矶大火而遭受重大财务损失。【原文：The world’s biggest reinsurers look set to avoid a major dent to their finances from their exposure to the Los Angeles fires, according to Fitch Ratings.】

item.title: 想要热泵？问问你的老板
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注的是英国一些公司试图在更大范围内减少排放足迹的创新方法：他们为员工提供热泵贷款。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享完整报道。如需了解更多气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at an innovative way some companies in the UK are trying to cut the broader scope of their emissions footprint: They’re giving employees loans for heat pumps. You can read and share the full story on Bloomberg.com. For more climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 特朗普的早期行动反映了他曾一度否定的 "2025 项目 "计划
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的一系列行政行动与他曾一度疏远的保守派政策蓝图中倡导的许多理念不谋而合。【原文：President Donald Trump’s blitz of executive actions align with many of the ideas promoted in a conservative policy blueprint he once distanced himself from.】

item.title: 想要热泵？问问你的雇主
item.description:
随着远程办公的兴起，一些公司正在提供一些福利，帮助英国员工减少家中的暖气排放。【原文：

With the rise of remote working, some companies are offering benefits that will help their UK employees cut heating emissions at home.

】

item.title: 艾奥云风暴导致数千人停电，航班停飞
item.description: 周五清晨，飓风袭击了爱尔兰和英国，导致成千上万的家庭和企业停电，整个地区的交通中断。【原文：Hurricane-strength winds battered Ireland and the UK early Friday morning, leaving thousands of homes and businesses without power and disrupting transportation across the region.】

item.title: 经济衰退，法国呼吁 "大规模 "暂停监管
item.description: 法国官员呼吁从环境、社会和公司治理（ESG）规则入手，对欧洲监管框架进行重大改革，以解决该集团全球竞争力不振的问题。【原文：French officials are calling for a major reworking of the European regulatory framework, starting with ESG rules, to address the bloc’s flailing global competitiveness.】

item.title: 维也纳采用热泵系统摒弃俄罗斯天然气
item.description:
奥地利首都计划投资 210 亿美元，通过热泵、钻井和提高能效来结束对进口天然气的依赖。【原文：

The Austrian capital has a $21 billion plan to end its dependence on imported natural gas with heat pumps, boreholes and energy efficiency.

】

item.title: 雾霾加剧，曼谷将实行一周免费公共交通
item.description: 泰国总理白通丹-西那瓦下令，从周六起，曼谷的公共交通一周内免费，因为当局正努力减少交通流量，缓解连日来令曼谷窒息的烟雾。【原文：Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra ordered public transport in Bangkok to be free for a week from Saturday, as authorities try to reduce traffic and ease the smog that has choked the city for days.】

item.title: 特朗普命令为重启 Keystone XL 管道提供了机会
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统似乎已经为建造 Keystone XL 输油管道打开了大门，这条有争议的石油管道甚至连其前开发商都不想建造。【原文：President Donald Trump appears to have opened the door for construction of the Keystone XL pipeline, the controversial oil conduit that even its former developer doesn’t want to build.】

item.title: 纽森就援助、移民和辱骂问题与特朗普摊牌
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）在周一迎接唐纳德-特朗普的就职典礼时，对新总统做出了和解的姿态，并指出需要建立伙伴关系和相互尊重。【原文：California Governor Gavin Newsom greeted Donald Trump’s inauguration Monday with a gesture of conciliation toward the new president, noting the need for partnership and mutual respect.】

item.title: 特朗普冻结联邦土地和水域的可再生能源项目
item.description: 特朗普政府正在冻结对联邦土地和水域上的风能和太阳能项目的授权，这凸显了华盛顿在政策上偏向化石燃料而非可再生能源的鲜明立场。【原文：The Trump administration is freezing authorizations for wind and solar projects on federal lands and water, underscoring the sharp Washington policy pivot to favor fossil fuels over renewables.】

item.title: 特朗普吹捧的千亿美元人工智能 "星际之门 "投资项目将利用太阳能发电
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统宣称将加速美国人工智能发展的千亿美元风险投资，预计将部分依赖于其关注气候问题的前任所青睐的动力来源— 太阳能和电池。【原文：A $100 billion venture that President Donald Trump heralds as accelerating artificial intelligence in the US is expected to depend in part on power sources favored by his climate-focused predecessor — solar and batteries.】

item.title: 巴西官员称特朗普退出《巴黎协定》将给 COP30 带来 "困难
item.description:
COP30主席安德烈-科雷亚-多拉戈（Andre Correa do Lago）表示，美国在气候变化问题上的反转将对全球峰会的讨论产生 "重大影响"。【原文：

The US reversal on climate change will have “a big influence” on discussions at the global summit, said COP30 President Andre Correa do Lago. 

】

item.title: 火灾遏制是如何起作用的，为什么在加利福尼亚如此困难？
item.description: 在洛杉矶人口稠密的社区爆发大火两个多星期后，消防员仍在奋力扑灭伊顿大火和帕利塞兹大火。这些大火造成至少 28 人死亡，16,000 多所房屋和建筑物被烧毁，而造成大火的原因是异常的冬季干旱和干燥的圣安娜风，这些风无情地吹过加利福尼亚的山脉，吹向太平洋。【原文：More than two weeks after flames erupted in densely populated neighborhoods in Los Angeles, firefighters were still struggling to put out the Eaton and Palisades fires. Those blazes — which left at least 28 people dead and destroyed more than 16,000 homes and buildings — were fueled by an unusual winter drought and dry Santa Ana winds relentlessly barreling over California’s mountain ranges and toward the Pacific Ocean.】

item.title: 特朗普退出巴黎协定后，彭博社将资助联合国气候机构
item.description:
迈克尔-布隆伯格（Michael Bloomberg）的慈善组织和其他组织正在介入，以维持美国对负责执行《巴黎协定》的机构的捐款。【原文：

Michael Bloomberg’s philanthropic organization and others are stepping in to maintain US contributions to the agency tasked with implementing the Paris Agreement.

】

item.title: 产能增长推动阿达尼绿色公司利润激增
item.description: 阿达尼绿色能源有限公司（Adani Green Energy Ltd. ）公布的第三季度利润增长了 92%，这主要得益于税收减免和发电量的增加。【原文：Adani Green Energy Ltd. reported a 92% increase in third-quarter profit, helped by a tax write-back and an increase in generation capacity that drove power output.】
